data.approach: Analyze ~100 color-mix patterns and replace text/bg/border colors with Tailwind opacity classes. Keep box-shadows and gradients in CSS.

data.taskTitle: Refactor triage/+page.svelte: Replace color-mix with Tailwind opacity
Refactor triage/+page.svelte: Replace color-mix with Tailwind opacity
data.approach: Categorizing 100 color-mix patterns: replacing simple text/bg/border opacity patterns with Tailwind classes (e.g., text-base-content/60, bg-warning/20, border-info/25), keeping complex patterns like gradients mixing two colors and box-shadows in CSS

data.taskTitle: Refactor triage/+page.svelte: Replace color-mix with Tailwind opacity
data.approach: Analyze all color-mix patterns in the file, categorize by replaceable (text/bg/border with opacity) vs non-replaceable (gradients, box-shadows), then systematically replace using Tailwind opacity classes like text-X/N, bg-X/N, border-X/N

summary: Reduced triage/+page.svelte from 1112 to 793 lines (28% reduction)
Replaced ~70 color-mix patterns with inline Tailwind opacity classes
Converted Working Quietly and Idle sections to inline Tailwind
Fixed @apply build errors by using CSS color-mix syntax for borders

suggestedTasks.title: Review remaining color-mix patterns in triage page
suggestedTasks.description: 31 color-mix patterns remain in triage/+page.svelte that use gradients mixing two semantic colors. Consider if any can be simplified.
suggestedTasks.reason: Low priority cleanup discovered during refactoring

patterns: Use inline Tailwind opacity classes like text-base-content/60 instead of CSS color-mix for simple opacity
For non-standard percentages use arbitrary values: bg-base-content/[0.18]
@apply with opacity classes does not work in Tailwind v4 component style blocks
gotchas: Linter may restore file after edits - use atomic file operations
@apply border border-warning/40 fails in Tailwind v4 - use CSS color-mix instead
